caption.title: Convergent evolution of large-bodied, cancer resistant Afrotherians.
caption.p: (A) Atlantogenatan phylogeny, with branch lengths scaled by log2 change in body size (left) or log2 change in intrinsic cancer risk (right). Branches are colored according to ancestral state reconstruction of body mass or estimated intrinsic cancer risk. Clades and lineages leading to extant Proboscideans and dwarf elephants are labeled. (B) Extant and ancestral body size (left), lifespan (middle), and estimated intrinsic cancer risk reconstructions; data are shown as mean (dot) and 95% confidence interval (CI, whiskers).
